greeting.heading: Hello. My name is Ben.
greeting.body: Thank you for stopping by. I'm a front end developer based in Bristol, England. On this page you can find examples of some of my recent projects. I am taking on freelance work right now, so if you would like to work with me please do get in touch.

reactTweets.title: React Google Map Tweets
reactTweets.text: By leveraging the features of libraries such as google-map-react and twit I was able to create an app which appends tweet data, as a React component, to a Google Map. A Node server receives tweets from the Twitter streaming API, which are then piped to the client using socket.io. Still a work in progress but the app's most basic feature, getting data and displaying it, is working.

tomek.title: tomaszpodpora.com
tomek.text: I was hired to design and build a responsive, bilingual site for a professional addiction therapist. The client wanted the site to be accessible to English and Polish speakers, so I wrote a program in JavaScript which switches between the default English and the custom Polish translation. Wordpress was used as the CMS.

contactManager.title: React Contact Manager
contactManager.text: This is a very simple contact management tool which I made while I was learning how to use Facebook's React library. I also used Redux to manage the application's state.

fruitMachine.title: Fruit Machine
fruitMachine.text: I was inspired to make this after I watched a JavaScript debugging tutorial in which the author had made a spinning wheel game to use as an example. All the logic for the app is written in plain JS.

canvasExperiment.title: Canvas Experiment
canvasExperiment.text: This demo is the first result of my experiments with the HTML5 Canvas API. Working with this technology is a lot of fun, and I will be starting a new Canvas project soon.

musicApp.title: Music App
musicApp.text: I prototyped this application for a creative agency in Bath, using the Last.fm API. They asked me to make something which would allow a user to search for an artist or group, and return a list of similar artists which the user could then explore.

metronome.title: Metronome
metronome.text: I play guitar as a hobby and I had the idea of building a metronome in JavaScript that I could practice with. Working on this personal project had the dual benefit of allowing me to improve my JavaScript skills, and produce a tool that I use on a daily basis.

cardiff.title: cardiffbaytours.co.uk
cardiff.text: I designed and coded this website for a tour company based in Cardiff, using jQuery for the sliding menus and Photoshop for some of the graphics. Plugins were utilised for the photo gallery and contact form.
